channel.title: Runserver.bat
channel.description:
In my runserver.bat when i try to run my server it says:
Starting fr33sc4p3 server on 0.0.0.0:43594
You would think that it would have worked by then,But it doesn't.
Please Help me.

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

um, no all he has to do is click runserver and enter the port and leave the ip at 127.0.0.1 and enter name and pass and he will be playing BY HIMSELF, and if he WANTS PEOPLE TO ENTER his server he will need to PORTFORWARD and then get NO-IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @thoompie thoompie
item.description:
@thoompie wrote:

its definately a firewall dudes…

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

Tr1pl3k1ll:

That is supposed to happen… When you do run.server it does NOT bring up its own client…

No it does not come with its own client. Just open moparscape client and enter the port as 43594 and the ip leave it at 127.0.0.1, Now to make ppl also log into the server you need to portforward and then get a no-ip to get the ppl into the server, you can get no-ip here www.no-ip.com , then just click log in and there you should be on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @mopar_I mopar I
item.description:
@mopar_I wrote:

[quote=“anthony says, post:9, topic:94944”]if u already havn’t: add

@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause right click your compiler and edit, delite everything in it.

and for runserver@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pauseand paste that into your runserver instead of whats already in it.
if that dont work i dunno :)[/quote]No it idn’t working if i x out of it it kicks me off the server and i have no idea how to get other ppl on.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @anthony_says anthony says
item.description:
@anthony_says wrote:

if u already havn’t: add

@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause right click your compiler and edit, delite everything in it.

and for runserver@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pauseand paste that into your runserver instead of whats already in it.
if that dont work i dunno

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @mopar_I mopar I
item.description:
@mopar_I wrote:

[quote=“Tr1pl3k1ll, post:4, topic:94944”]That is supposed to happen.
Keep that window up.
Go to moparscape client, enter 43594 for port, and 0.0.0.0 for ip.
Make a username and pass. And loggin.Thank you! it worked i can log on my server but if i keep the window up it makes mopar go reallly slow.

  • Tr1p[/quote][br][size=1]Posted on: May 15, 2007, 03:49:47 PM[/size][hr]When i keep the window up another window comes up and it makes mopar go realy slow and when i x out of it my server says connection lost please wait attempting to reestablish.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @thoompie thoompie
item.description:
@thoompie wrote:

If u setup a no-ip account, you can enter it in your webbrowser, to get in your router.(f.e. in my case, i enter Krijtscape.no-ip.org as website)
You will be prompted for a username and Pass, mostly Username: Admin |Password: Admin
when your in the router, look for virtual server, port forwarding or firewall, somethink like that…
you will have to give your IP, i suppose you know how to get that right (the ip that your router assigned to your computer)
the port range, so maybe 43593~43595 is good…
and do it for both TCP and UDP.
should work like a charm now…
if it doesnt, you will have to create an exception in windows firewall.

Read full topic
